answers.answer: Well on the positive note, usually GD babies are a little larger than normal babies! :)  Hang in there, and find something for yourself.  Pamper yourself, even if it is a bubble bath and incense or something, or a nice dinner that you didn't have to cook.

I am so sorry you are feeling so miserable, but I promise you that when you deliver these healthy, beautiful girls it will all be worth it.  You are already proving yourself to be a good mother by the care you are taking of yourself.By the way, I believe you mentioned that you were First Nations....here in Canada there seems to be a higher rate of GD and all forms of diabetes among the First Nations folks, is it the same in the US?

I am Native American. yeppers we are at a higher risk of diabetes.i looked at the risk factors for GD in my little book from my insurer, they list;native american descent( among others)over 25obesitymultiple gestationsi have 3 out of 4 and though i am not obese i do have a few extra pounds. it would appear that i was destined to get this. lol.

i have GD and it sucks no  insulin but I do take glyburide (sp) and have to test 4 times a day and go get nst and bio done every week for the last 6 weeks and still have 2 more weeks to go only because i will be induced at 38 weeks due to a large baby when i was 33 weeks he was 5lbs 10 oz i have an us next week to see what he is then and then its over yea! goodluck to you hope all goes well.

thanks :) my girls are huge already.  2 weeks ago they weighed 3#13ozs and 4#6ozs so that's probably going to happen to me too. they have not started nsts yet but they are checking my cervix every week. i have just almost 7 weeks to go(supposedly. lol. we all knows babies come when they want to)

question: blah!!!!! i went to the doctor this morning. i hate going to the doctors anymore. i really really do. it's sad because aren't we supposed to look forward to that? well i don't!i received that wonderful gestational diabetes diagnosis a week or so ago and am taking insulin shots every morning,checking my blood 4 times a day,  eating 6 times a day, drinking 3 quarts of water a day, sodium restricting, laying on my left side and propping my feet. it doesn't feel like i have time for anything else and if i do do anything else it will cause yet another issue.sorry to rant, but my god, does it ever get better?!today i was told that i am spilling ketones( even though i drink a ton and my blood sugars have been under control) another insulin shot was added to my regimen before bed and i am losing weight. i have until Friday the 24th to get it all under control or i am going to be admitted into the hospital. oh and i somehow managed to get dehydrated, which is causing me to contract.on a good note, the girls are doing excellent, big, feisty and all. they move what feels like 20 of the 24 hours in a day and we get their weights again on the 28th( i'm kinda scared of that appointment)so the girls are doing well, but my body is failing? does anyone have gestational diabetes pointers for me? i already am following the 2200 calorie diet and eating on the schedule.feel free to use as an open forum, i just needed to get that off my chest.
title: sick and tired of being sick and tired
